# NON-Modifiable Deployment Restrictions
## Nuclear Protocol
In the event of nuclear ordnance being deployed, all personnel are authorized to deploy to the [bold]FOB[/bold] to protect it during countdown, which overrides all other department SOP preventing deployments.
- The [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] may order personnel to remain aboard the ship at their discretion. - Prisoners may not be deployed.
## Commander Field Deployment
- The [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] has the right to deploy to the frontline for the sake of commanding their personnel from a direct point of view. Deployments must be for the sake of the personnel and operation, and not for the personal glory of the [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color]. - A [color=#90EE90][bold]Duty Officer[/bold][/color] may not deploy. - This right to deploy is exclusive to the [color=#00CBFE][bold]Commanding Officer[/bold][/color] and [bold]Executive Officer[/bold], it cannot be transferred.
[bold]Preparing to Deploy[/bold]
- The [color=#00CBFE][bold]Commanding Officer[/bold][/color] and [bold]Executive Officer[/bold] should not be deployed at the same time, if both are present. - Deployment should not be done unless they are confident CIC can be managed in their absence. - Actions taken by [bold]CIC Personnel[/bold] in the absence is the responsibility of the [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color]. - If the [color=#00CBFE][bold]Commanding Officer[/bold][/color] is present, the [bold]Executive Officer[/bold] requires permission to deploy, otherwise they must notify [bold]CIC Personnel[/bold] of their intent to deploy. - The [color=#00CBFE][bold]Commanding Officer[/bold][/color] must notify [bold]CIC Personnel[/bold] of their intent to deploy. - The [color=#00CBFE][bold]Commanding Officer[/bold][/color] may appoint honor guards for their own protection but [bold]Executive Officer[/bold]s must request permission from the [color=#00CBFE][bold]Commanding Officer[/bold][/color] to do the same.
[bold]When Deployed[/bold]
- The deploying [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] must still command and communicate frequently with both the [bold]CIC[/bold] and marine crews. - Combat should be reserved when assisting the marines in a supporting capacity, in defense of others and self, or directly leading an offensive maneuver. - They should avoid unnecessarily putting themselves in danger, and remain close to marines to focus on providing clear orders.
## Shipside Personnel
Personnel normally restricted to shipside duties such as doctors and Military Police may be deployed to the [bold]FOB[/bold]; however special circumstances or clearances are needed.
- Department Heads may not deploy at all, with the exception of the [bold]Chief Engineer[/bold] under some conditions. - All personnel that intend to deploy, including Staff Officers [bold]require permission[/bold] from either their head of department, or the [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color]. - All civilian personnel, excluding recovered personnel defined by [textlink="NON-Modifiable Third-Party Personnel" link="RMCMarineSOPNONModThirdparty"] [bold]require permission[/bold] from the [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] to deploy. - The [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] may overrule the department head regarding deployment.
[bold]Engineering[/bold]
- The [bold]Chief Engineer[/bold] may deploy to the [bold]FOB[/bold] if there is an [bold]Auxiliary Support Officer[/bold] on board, but still requires permission from them or the [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color]. - Both the [bold]Chief Engineer[/bold] and maintenance techs may only deploy with the purpose of building the [bold]FOB[/bold], and telecommunications, but must leave if these areas are no longer considered secure.
[bold]Medical[/bold]
- Doctors and Nurses may deploy to the [bold]FOB[/bold], and designated [bold]Field Hospital[/bold], until they are no longer [bold]Secure Area[/bold]s.
[bold]Requisitions[/bold]
- Cargo techs may deploy to the [bold]FOB[/bold] to assist in organizing and accounting for supplies.
[bold]Military Police[/bold]
- [bold]CIC Personnel[/bold] may request up to four volunteers from the [color=#ff000d][bold]MP[/bold][/color] to be deployed to the [bold]FOB[/bold] and [bold]Secure Area[/bold]s to protect deployed shipside crew and handle arrests. - This is unrelated to [color=#00CBFE][bold]Commanding Officer[/bold][/color] escorts, and can be overridden by either higher ranking personnel or the [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color]. - At least one [color=#ff000d][bold]MP[/bold][/color] must remain on the ship at all times. If the [color=#8B0000][bold]Chief MP[/bold][/color] is present, it must be them. - The [bold]Warden[/bold] may deploy to perform requested arrests in the absence of [color=#ff000d][bold]MP[/bold][/color] officers, but should otherwise remain on the ship. - Deployed [color=#ff000d][bold]MP[/bold][/color] may move between [bold]Secure Area[/bold]s and should be avoiding combat while doing so, unless in protection of non-combat personnel like doctors or themselves. - [color=#ff000d][bold]MP[/bold][/color] should retreat and assist non-combat personnel in retreating from a [bold]Secure Area[/bold] if it is no longer secure. - [color=#ff000d][bold]MP[/bold][/color] may be required to transfer a prisoner from the AO to the ship, and should, to the best of their ability, ensure the prisoner makes it to the ship safely.
